        min - The minimum integer that can be read by this method.

        public static double readNum(java.lang.String prompt,
                             double min,
                             double max)
        The readNum method reads in a valid double that is between the values specified by the minimum parameter and maximum parameter, inclusive.

      • readNum

        public static int readNum(java.lang.String prompt,
                          int limit,
                          boolean minMax)
        The readNum method reads in a valid integer than is either greater than the value of the limit field, if the minMax value is true, or less, if the the minMax value is false.
        Parameters:
        prompt - The message that is written in the console in the event of an invalid input.
        limit - The double value that represents either the minimum or maximum value, depending on the boolean value of minMax.
        minMax - The boolean that determines whether the limit represents the minimum acceptable double, if true, or the maximum, if false.
        Returns:
        The value in the number field.

      • readNum

        public static double readNum(java.lang.String prompt,
                             double limit,
                             boolean minMax)
        The readNum method reads in a valid double than is either greater than the value of the limit field, if the minMax value is true, or less, if the the minMax value is false.
        Parameters:
        prompt - The message that is written in the console in the event of an invalid input.
        limit - The integer value that represents either the minimum or maximum value, depending on the boolean value of minMax.
        minMax - The boolean that determines whether the limit represents the minimum acceptable integer, if true, or the maximum, if false.
        Returns:
        The value in the number field.
